body: This PR is the current WIP state of trying to get c-toxcore fuzz tested in CI. The initial goal is to provide a setup where we can easily add other fuzz harnesses that focus on different parts of c-toxcore. Since "Fuzzer" is a relatively undefined word, here are some definitions for this PR: Fuzzer: a system that executes binaries, mutates their input and tries to maximize coverage Fuzz Harness: a wrapper binary that is executed by a fuzzer to fuzz a library and optimizes the library for fuzz testing The parts to implement are: - [x] Fuzz harness for one area of c-toxcore, so far we have: - Bootstrap: focus on code run during the bootstrap process - Toxencryptsave: focus on parser code for the *.tox file format (currently not executed in scripts) - [x] Modify c-toxcore so that network access, time, randomness and encryption are not blocking fuzzing proceess - [x] create a proof of concept that fuzzing is a sensible strategie to test c-toxcore (see #1718 why it makes sense) - [x] Make running a fuzzing campaing easier (Docker?) - [x] Automatically run fuzz testing for c-toxcore commits and maybe even PRs (https://google.github.io/clusterfuzzlite/) - [ ] Setup up the necessary integration for Clusterfuzzlite: https://google.github.io/clusterfuzzlite/running-clusterfuzzlite/ (I'll handle that separately) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1720)

comment_data.body: `ninja-build` appears twice.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,67 @@
+# based on https://github.com/AFLplusplus/AFLplusplus/blob/stable/Dockerfile
+
+FROM ubuntu:20.04 AS toxcore-fuzz
+
+SHELL ["/bin/bash", "-o", "pipefail", "-c"]
+
+ARG DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
+
+env NO_ARCH_OPT 1
+
+RUN apt-get update && \
+    apt-get -y install --no-install-suggests --no-install-recommends \
+    automake \
+    ninja-build \
+    bison flex \
+    build-essential \
+    git \
+    python3 python3-dev python3-setuptools python-is-python3 \
+    libtool libtool-bin \
+    libglib2.0-dev \
+    wget vim jupp nano bash-completion less \
+    apt-utils apt-transport-https ca-certificates gnupg dialog \
+    libpixman-1-dev \
+    gnuplot-nox \
+    screen \
+    cmake \
+    parallel \
+    libsodium-dev \
+    ninja-build\

@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+/* SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
+ * Copyright © 2021 The TokTok team.
+ */
+
+#ifndef C_TOXCORE_TESTING_FUZZING_FUZZ_ADAPTER_H
+#define C_TOXCORE_TESTING_FUZZING_FUZZ_ADAPTER_H
+
+#include <stdint.h>
+#include <arpa/inet.h>
+#include <sys/socket.h>
+
+#ifdef __cplusplus
+extern "C" {
+#endif
+
+/**
+ * @brief Init function for the fuzzing harness
+ * @param buf Begin of fuzz data
+ * @param length Length of buf
+ */
+void network_adapter_init(const uint8_t *buf, size_t length);
+
+/* The following functions intercept calls to standard network functions for fuzzing purposes and return data from the fuzz buffer. */
+
+ssize_t fuzz_sendto(int __fd, const void *__buf, size_t __n,
+                    int __flags, __CONST_SOCKADDR_ARG __addr,
+                    socklen_t __addr_len);
+
+ssize_t fuzz_send(int __fd, const void *__buf, size_t __n, int __flags);
+
+ssize_t fuzz_recvfrom(int __fd, void *__restrict __buf, size_t __n,

comment_data.body: Add a `.hadolint.yml` in the repo root dir, containing a suppression for DL3059 (see https://github.com/TokTok/dockerfiles/blob/master/.hadolint.yaml#L6).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+# c-toxcore Clusterfuzzlite build environment
+
+# We want to use the latest tools always
+# hadolint ignore=DL3006
+FROM gcr.io/oss-fuzz-base/base-builder
+
+RUN apt-get update && \
+    apt-get -y install --no-install-suggests --no-install-recommends \
+    cmake libtool autoconf automake pkg-config \
+    && apt-get clean \
+    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
+
+
+RUN git clone --depth 1 --branch 1.0.18 https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium libsodium

+cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug "$COMMON_CMAKE_OPTIONS" ..
+
+# build fuzzer target

+
+cd ..
+
+# build fuzzer target with CmpLog
+mkdir -p _afl_build_cmplog
+cd _afl_build_cmplog
+
+export AFL_LLVM_CMPLOG=1
+
+# build c-toxcore using afl instrumentation
+cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug "$COMMON_CMAKE_OPTIONS" ..
+
+# build fuzzer target
+cmake --build ./ --target bootstrap_fuzzer
+
+unset AFL_LLVM_CMPLOG
+
+cd ..
+
+# build fuzzer target for code coverage
+mkdir -p _cov_build
+cd _cov_build
+
+# build c-toxcore using afl instrumentation
+cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage" -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage" -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON "$COMMON_CMAKE_OPTIONS" ..
+

+
+# back to repo root
+cd ../
+
+# Create fuzzer working directory
+
+mkdir -p _afl_out
+
+AFL_ARGS='-i testing/afl_testdata/tox_bootstraps/ -o _afl_out'
+
+export AFL_IMPORT_FIRST=1
+export AFL_AUTORESUME=1
+
+# faster startup
+export AFL_FAST_CAL=1
+
+echo "connect to the fuzzers using: screen -x fuzz"
+echo "if fuzzing doesn't start execute the following as root:"
+echo ""
+echo "echo core >/proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern"
+echo "echo performance | tee /sys/devices/system/cpu/cpu*/cpufreq/scaling_governor"
+
+# Main fuzzer, keeps complet corpus

comment_data.body: Fuzzers won't be compiled with NDEBUG, but I'd still prefer this as a separate line so there are no side-effectful asserts. The reason is that people will copy/paste code from wherever. I'd rather have that copy/pasted code be reasonable.
Might want to assert this allocation succeeds. Assertion failures are nicer than segfaults.
Add `BUILD_FUZZ_TESTS` to [`INSTALL.md`](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/INSTALL.md#cmake-options), it attempts to provide a comprehensive list of cmake options.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -533,8 +533,23 @@ if (BUILD_MISC_TESTS)
   if(OpenMP_C_FOUND)
       target_link_libraries(cracker OpenMP::OpenMP_C)
   endif()
+endif()
+
+# Enabling this breaks all other tests and no network connections will be possible
+option(BUILD_FUZZ_TESTS "Build fuzzing harnesses" OFF)

comment_regular_data.body:
Added a dockerfile to make executing this easier for now:

1) Copy your c-toxcore sourcefolder (paranoia mode, the Docker will mount this as RW location)
2) cd into c-toxcore/testing
3) build docker image `docker build -t sudden6/toxcore-fuzz .`
4) run docker `docker run -ti -v <absolute path to c-toxcore copy>:/src sudden6/toxcore-fuzz`
5) inside the container do `cd /src/testing/`
6) run `./run_afl.sh` for fuzzing campain`

The other two scripts in this directory minimize the corpus and generate coverage, both are untested so far
Seemst the reason for 2 space indent was `clang-format` on our CI, are C++ files intentionally indented differently?

# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1720?src=pr&el=h1&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=TokTok) Report

commit.message:
add fuzzing harnesses

Toxsave harness ported to libFuzzer interface.
New harness for bootstrap phase.

verification.payload:
tree a7588b27f8a579f91f4956230e09bf8a1e0e2e60
parent 210ea9e25c1a88af7e00d7d44fc302d29711349c
author sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1638706047 +0100
committer sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1641844620 +0100

add fuzzing harnesses

Toxsave harness ported to libFuzzer interface.
New harness for bootstrap phase.

commit.message:
intercept network, crypto and time

This fuzzing harness must be as deterministic as possible for the fuzzer
to detect additional coverage reliably.

verification.payload:
tree c76b3ad0e8656e47a604cefdd64c9c2df79e9b51
parent 9eb88798a3fd974e07abb3f4bb321b708541c861
author sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1638706203 +0100
committer sudden6 <sudden6@gmx.at> 1641845149 +0100

intercept network, crypto and time

This fuzzing harness must be as deterministic as possible for the fuzzer
to detect additional coverage reliably.

commit.message:
add scripts to run the fuzzing process

This adds scripts and Dockerfiles to run the fuzzing process standalone
or with OSS-Fuzz/ClusterFuzzLite integrations.

verification.payload:
tree 953da03de060e3ee1fb12a06469c5f20dd488f3e
parent 7dd8dbd897278883ff96b6f0a5214196b2fefaa8

add scripts to run the fuzzing process

This adds scripts and Dockerfiles to run the fuzzing process standalone
or with OSS-Fuzz/ClusterFuzzLite integrations.
